091/**
092 *  A collection of SVG related utility methods and factory methods for SVG
093 *  elements.
094 *
095 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
096 *  @version $Id: SVGUtils.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $
097 *  @since 0.0.5
098 *
099 *  @UMLGraph.link
100 */
101@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass", "OverlyCoupledClass"} )
102@UtilityClass
103@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: SVGUtils.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $" )
104public final class SVGUtils
105{
106        /*-----------*\
107    ====** Constants **========================================================
108        \*-----------*/

113    public static final String SVG_PREFIX = "svg";

1915     *      drawing it in a &quot;negative-angle&quot; direction.

2038    /**
2039     *  Clones the given element.<br>
2040     *  <br>The clone will be semantically identical to the given element (it
2041     *  looks the same in the final output), but it will not be of the same
2042     *  Java type.
2043     *
2044     *  @param  element The element to clone.
2045     *  @return The clone.
2046     */
2047    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2048    public static final SVGElement cloneElement( final SVGElement element )
2049    {
2050        final var elementName = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getElementName();
2051        @SuppressWarnings( "CastToConcreteClass" )
2052        final var xmlElement = ((XMLElementAdapter) element);
2053        final var flags = xmlElement.getFlags().toArray( Flags[]::new );
2054        final var retValue = new SVGGenericElement( elementName, flags );
2055
2056        retValue.registerValidAttributes( xmlElement.retrieveValidAttributes().toArray( String []::new ) );
2057        retValue.registerValidChildren( xmlElement.retrieveValidChildren().toArray( String []::new ) );
2058
2059        element.getAttributes().forEach( retValue::setAttribute );
2060        element.getChildren().forEach( c -> retValue.addChild( cloneElement( (SVGElement) c ) ) );
2061        element.getNamespaces().forEach( retValue::setNamespace );
2062
2063        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2064        return retValue;
2065    }   //  cloneElement()
2066
2067    /**
2068     *  Creates an instance of the
2069     *  {@linkplain org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGPathElement path element}
2070     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGPathElement.SVGClosePath}
2071     *  that uses relative coordinates.
2072     *
2073     *  @return The new path element.
2074     */
2075    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2076    public static final SVGPathElement closePath()
2077    {
2078        final var retValue = new SVGClosePath();
2079
2080        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2081        return retValue;
2082    }   //  closePath()

2201    /**
2202     *  Creates a generic SVG element.<br>
2203     *  <br>This method should be used to create an SVG element that does not
2204     *  have (yet) its specific implementation class. It does not work to
2205     *  introduce completely new, still unknown SVG elements, as it checks the
2206     *  given element name.<br>
2207     *  <br>The returned instance will also check which attributes are allowed
2208     *  for the element it represents as well as which children are allowed to
2209     *  it.
2210     *
2211     *  @param  elementName The name for the new element.
2212     *  @return The new generic SVG element.
2213     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The given element name does not
2214     *      denote a define SVG element.
2215     */
2216    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2217    public static final SVGGenericElement createGenericElement( final String elementName )
2218    {
2219        if( retrieveElementCategory( elementName ).isEmpty() )
2220        {
2221            throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "Unknown element name: %s", elementName ) );
2222        }
2223
2224        final var retValue = new SVGGenericElement( elementName );
2225
2226        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2227        return retValue;
2228    }   //  createGenericElement()
2229

2512     *  @return The new {@code <rect>} element.

2516    {

2522        return retValue;

2524
2525    /**
2526     *  Creates an SVG {@code <svg>} element instance.
2527     *
2528     *  @param  usage  How the new {@code <svg>} element should be used.
2529     *  @return The new {@code <svg>} element.
2530     */
2531    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2532    public static final SVG createSVG( final Usage usage )
2533    {
2534        final var retValue = new SVGImpl();
2535
2536        switch( requireNonNullArgument( usage, "usage" ) )
2537        {
2538            case EMBED_HTML ->
2539            {
2540                retValue.setNamespace( createSVGNamespace( SVG_PREFIX ) );
2541                retValue.setNamespace( createXLINKNamespace() );
2542                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_BaseProfile, "full" );
2543                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_Version, "1.1" );
2544            }
2545
2546            case EMBED_HTML5 ->
2547            {
2548                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_BaseProfile, "full" );
2549                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_Version, "1.1" );
2550            }
2551
2552            case EMBED_SVG -> { /* Does nothing */ }
2553
2554            case STANDALONE_DOCUMENT ->
2555            {
2556                /*
2557                 * This configuration was taken more or less (more less) from
2558                 * an SVG document created with Inkscape.
2559                 */
2560                retValue.setNamespace( createSVGNamespace( SVG_PREFIX ) );
2561                retValue.setNamespace( createSVGNamespace( EMPTY_STRING ) );
2562                retValue.setNamespace( createXLINKNamespace() );
2563                retValue.setNamespace( createCCNamespace() );
2564                retValue.setNamespace( createRDFNamespace() );
2565                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_BaseProfile, "full" );
2566                retValue.setAttribute( SVGATTRIBUTE_Version, "1.1" );
2567            }
2568
2569            default -> throw new UnsupportedEnumError( usage );
2570        }
2571
2572        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2573        return retValue;
2574    }   //  createSVG()
2575
2576    /**
2577     *  Creates an SVG {@code <svg>} element instance and adds it to the given
2578     *  parent.
2579     *
2580     *  @param  parent  The parent for the new {@code <svg>} element.
2581     *  @return The new {@code <svg>} element.
2582     */
2583    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
2584    public static final SVG createSVG( final SVGElementWithChildren parent )
2585    {
2586        final var retValue = createSVG( EMBED_SVG );
2587        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
2588
2589        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2590        return retValue;
2591    }   //  createSVG()
2592

2602    {
2603        final var retValue = createXMLDocument( (XMLElement) rootElement, false );
2604
2605        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2606        return retValue;
2607    }   //  createSVGDocument()

2609    /**
2610     *  Creates the namespace instance that is used for all SVG stuff.
2611     *
2612     *  @param  prefix  The prefix; can be empty or {@code null}.
2613     *  @return The new namespace instance.
2614     */
2615    private static final Namespace createSVGNamespace( final String prefix )
2616    {
2617        final var identifier = URI.create( "http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" );
2618        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( prefix ) ? new Namespace( prefix, identifier ) : new Namespace( identifier );
2619
2620        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
2621        return retValue;
2622    }   //  createSVGNamespace()

2934     *  @param  y1   The y coordinate for the first control point.
2935     *  @param  x2   The x coordinate for the second control point
2936     *  @param  y2   The y coordinate for the second control point
